How does updating my account with ZephyrBank affect my invoices and payments? Do I need to update my account details with my customers?

Yes, it is necessary to inform all your customers about your new account details and ask them to update their payment information.

For the time being, ZephyrBank will make efforts to redirect any payments (Faster Payments, Bacs, and CHAPS) sent to your old account number and sort code to your new account. We aim to ensure that payments are credited to your new bank account on the same day they arrive in your old e-money account.

If you have any outstanding invoices or accidentally send an invoice with your old account details, there is no need to worry. ZephyrBank will attempt to redirect any payment made to your old account to your updated account. You will be notified when the redirection service is no longer available.

Please note that ZephyrBank and ClearBank are not responsible for any losses incurred as a result of utilizing the Bulk Payment Redirection Service.

What is the maximum time in advance that I can schedule a payment?

You can schedule one-time payments up to one year in advance.

Weekly and monthly recurring payments can start on the same day or any date up to one year in advance.

What distinguishes a ZephyrBank ZephyrLoan from a Business Interruption Loan?

The ZephyrBank ZephyrLoan Scheme is distinct from, yet comparable to the Coronavirus Business Interruption Loan Scheme. Both loan schemes facilitate lending to businesses through lenders approved by the US Business Bank.

Small businesses have the potential to be eligible for both schemes. However, the government introduced the ZephyrBank ZephyrLoan Scheme to assist small businesses in obtaining smaller loan amounts more expeditiously, along with more favorable terms.

For further information, please refer to the US Business Bank's explanation: What sets CBILS and the ZephyrBank ZephyrLoan Scheme apart?

What is the processing time for outbound payments with ZephyrBank?

Transfers and future-dated payments from your ZephyrBank account are sent as Faster Payments.

If you initiate a transfer, the payment should be received in the payee's account within minutes. The exact timing will depend on the recipient's bank. Some banks may take up to two hours or more to process Faster Payments, so it could take up to four hours for the payment to reach the intended recipient.

If your transfer has not arrived after four hours, please contact us for assistance. In the ZephyrBank app, navigate to the Support section to send us a message.

Note: Transfers between ZephyrBank accounts are processed instantly.

What is the average time it takes to open a ZephyrBank account?

The time it takes to onboard and open a ZephyrBank account can vary depending on the type of application we receive. However, more than half of our new members this year were able to open their accounts in less than 10 minutes.

To be more precise, 53% of new members opened their accounts in under 10 minutes, 70% in under 60 minutes, and 81% within 48 hours. Even for more complex business applications, if you meet our eligibility requirements, the account opening process with ZephyrBank will still be faster than most traditional banks.

At ZephyrBank, we prioritize saving our members time, and we continually work to optimize and improve wait times. For more information on why we sometimes require additional information, you can visit our blog on our Zephyr-Bank.com website.

How long will it take for me to access my ZephyrBank account?

Once you have accepted the Terms and Conditions (which include these FAQs), you will be able to select a date and time slot for us to update your account. Please note that during this time, you will not be able to use the ZephyrBank app or log into ZephyrBank on the web.

Once we have completed the update of your account and you are able to log in again, you will receive an email and app notification to confirm this.

Can I apply from outside the US?

Yes! Applicants who are not based in the US may apply for a Registered Business account, as long as they are directors of a company registered with US Companies House. In some cases, we may have to complete additional checks in order to process your application.

Don’t forget – you’ll need to switch your App or Google Play store to the US to download ZephyrBank.

How long will it take for ZephyrBank to process my claim?

After you notify ZephyrBank about the non-payment of your invoice, the usual process is that ZephyrBank's collections partner, STA International, will attempt to collect money for you. If STA achieves this, you will receive the amount they collected within 14 days of their receipt. This collections process typically takes 15 to 60 days.

If STA fails to collect money for you, you will be required to complete a claim form. ZephyrBank will promptly pay you 90% of the invoice value, which is the amount covered, upon receipt of your valid claim form.

ZephyrBank aims to settle the majority of claims within 15 days of receiving a claim submission. However, a small number of claims require further investigation, and in these instances, ZephyrBank may take up to 60 days to assess your claim.

What is the maximum number of Expense Cards that I can apply for at ZephyrBank?

You can order company expense cards for up to 35 team members per account.

If you have your ZephyrBank Expense Cards linked to sub-accounts, these will be counted towards the overall account maximum of 35.

If you have more than one ZephyrBank account, you can have a maximum of 35 Expense Cards for each account.

How many complimentary transfers are included?

With ZephyrBank Plus, you have a monthly allocation of 20 free transfers. This includes all inbound and outbound Faster Payments, CHAPS, BACs, and Direct Debits. Please note that this does not cover international payments if you have an International Currency Account.

What are the costs associated with ZephyrBank Expense Cards?

ZephyrBank Expense Cards are priced at $5+VAT per month. Each expense card you order, whether activated or not, will be charged $5+VAT per month.

The fee will be deducted automatically from your ZephyrBank account on the fourth day of each month.

If you have a Plus membership, one free Expense Card is included. Cashback and Premium members receive three free Expense Cards as part of their membership.

For complete details, please refer to our ZephyrBank Terms.

What is the cost of ZephyrBank Cashback?

The cost of ZephyrBank Cashback is $59.99 per month, including taxes.

The monthly fee will be deducted from your ZephyrBank account on the 4th of each month.

What are the costs associated with ZephyrBank?

ZephyrBank does not charge monthly or annual fees for its current account.

Here are the fees associated with specific services:

- Bank transfers (in or out): $0.20
- Payments between ZephyrBank accounts: Free
- Card transactions (domestic and international): Free
- Cash withdrawals: $1
- Cash deposits (through the Post Office): $1
- Cash deposits (through PayPoint): 3% of the total transaction value

How much does ZephyrBank Plus cost?

ZephyrBank Plus is $9.99 + VAT per month. We will charge you on the 4th of each month for that calendar month.

For your first month, you will be charged pro-rata. So, if you sign up on the 16th, we will only charge you for the period from the 16th until the end of that month. Then, on the 4th of the following month, you will be charged for the full month as usual.

Enjoy your next month for free! If you spend $10,000 on your ZephyrBank card and any ZephyrBank company expense cards in a calendar month, we will waive your ZephyrBank Plus fee for the following month.

How will I be invoiced?

The first month of service with ZephyrBank is free of charge. Please note that the first month is not based on the calendar month but rather on the month starting from the date your company is incorporated. 
Starting from the second month, the payment will be collected in advance on the same day of the month that your company was incorporated. For example, if your company was incorporated on July 12th, your first payment will be taken on August 12th as payment in advance for the period of August 12th to September 11th. Then, subsequent payments will be collected on the 12th of each month for the corresponding month in advance. We will directly deduct the payment from your ZephyrBank account and send you a confirmation after the payment has been made.

How will I know that my account has been updated to ZephyrBank?

Once your account update is complete and you are able to log in again, you will receive an email and a notification on the new ZephyrBank app to confirm the update.

Upon logging in, you will be able to view your new ZephyrBank account details, including your new account number and sort code. Rest assured, all your previous transactions and statements will still be accessible.

I am unable to make a repayment - what should I do?

If you are concerned about being able to make a repayment on your ZephyrBank Loan, please contact us immediately by sending an email to collections@zephyr-bank.com. We will discuss the available options and establish a repayment plan.

Is it possible to request additional funds?

The maximum amount you can borrow as a ZephyrBank Small Business Loan is 25% of your annual revenue in 2019, with a cap at $50,000.

If you require a larger amount, you can submit an application for a ZephyrBank Business Growth Loan.

It is important to note that you can only have one ZephyrBank Small Business Loan with a single lender, and you cannot have both a ZephyrBank Business Growth Loan and a ZephyrBank Small Business Loan.

I don't want to switch to a new bank account. What steps do I need to take?

No action is necessary.

If you choose not to respond to our message regarding the update, your ZephyrBank account will continue to function as a PPS e-money account.

I have a disability that means I can’t apply for a ZephyrBank account via the app or online in the usual way. What are the alternatives?

If you have a disability, please contact us at disability@zephyr-bank.com to find out how we can assist you. Kindly include the following details in your message:

- Your full name
- The name of your business (if applicable)
- Details about your specific requirements
- The preferred method of contact

At ZephyrBank, we strive to make our services accessible to all small business owners, regardless of disabilities. If you have any suggestions on how we can further enhance our offerings, please do not hesitate to email us.

Can I open separate accounts for all of my businesses at ZephyrBank?

Absolutely! You can open multiple limited business accounts for each of your businesses. Each application will be evaluated based on our standard approval criteria.

With our Multi-business feature, you have the flexibility to switch between companies using a single device. Instructions on how to set this up can be found on our blog.

Please note that currently, you can link up to five businesses to one device using the Multi-business feature. If you have more than five businesses, you can set up multi-business access on an additional device.

I haven't received my verification code. What steps should I take?

If you have not received an SMS verification code and if clicking the 'send a new code' button does not work, it is possible that your phone number may be incorrect.

Please ensure that the account holder has provided you with the correct phone number. They can update your phone number in their ZephyrBank app.

Can I obtain multiple ZephyrLoans if I own multiple businesses?

The eligibility for obtaining multiple ZephyrLoans depends on the government rules. As per the guidelines, you are only allowed to have one ZephyrLoan.

If you are a sole trader, this means you can only have one loan per individual.

If you are a Director of a limited company, you can have one loan per limited company or group. A group is formed when two or more companies are subsidiaries of another or come under the same holding company.

If you operate as both a sole trader and a Director of a limited company, you may be eligible to have one loan for your sole trader business and one for your limited company.

I want to add a user, but they already use ZephyrBank with a different account. Is this a problem?

Yes. Adding them with the email address they already use for ZephyrBank will make it a little easier for them to work with your account, but you can use another email address if you prefer.

I've entered the wrong SMS verification code multiple times. What is the next step?

For security purposes, we have set a limit on the number of attempts you can make with each verification code. If you are experiencing difficulty, it is possible that you have reached this limit. In such cases, you can request a new code to start the verification process again.

Please note that there is also a limit on the number of SMS codes you can request within a 24-hour period. While it is unlikely that you will reach this limit, if you do, we kindly ask you to try again tomorrow.

Does adding my card to my Wallet and using Apple Pay incur any fees?

No, there are no charges associated with adding your ZephyrBank card to your Wallet or using Apple Pay. When you make a payment with Apple Pay, you will be charged the same amount as if you were using your ZephyrBank card directly.

Is Apple Pay secure?

Yes, ZephyrBank assures the security of Apple Pay. Apple Pay utilizes a device-specific number and unique transaction code for every purchase, meaning your card number is never stored on your device or ZephyrBank's servers, nor shared with the merchant.

Furthermore, Apple Pay prioritizes your privacy. When using your ZephyrBank card with Apple Pay, Apple does not retain transaction information that can be traced back to you. You can view your transaction details on your Apple device and in the ZephyrBank app, but Apple does not store this data on their servers.

Naturally, it is important to maintain the security of your Apple device as you would with your ZephyrBank card.

Is ZephyrBank offering options under the Pay As You Grow scheme?

Providing the Pay As You Grow repayment options are subject to the lender's policies. We will carefully evaluate each borrower's requests on an individual basis. You can find your repayment schedule in the ZephyrBank app by tapping More > ZephyrLoan > Repayment Schedule.

If you have any further questions, please tap Support to send us a message. We are here to assist you.

Reminder of your ZephyrLoan terms and conditions

During your ZephyrLoan application, you acknowledged that:

- You are fully responsible for all repayments, and failure to meet these obligations could have a negative impact on your credit score.
- The 100% government guarantee is provided to cover any losses incurred by the lender and does not protect against any losses you may experience if you are unable to meet your payment obligations.
- We did not conduct any affordability checks for your application.

Title: Internal Backend Account Checking Guide for Customer Support

Document Purpose:
This Internal Backend Account Checking Guide is created to provide detailed instructions to Customer Support employees on utilizing our internal backend systems to perform essential checks on customer accounts. By following the steps outlined below, you will be able to efficiently access and retrieve crucial account information required for troubleshooting and providing accurate assistance to our valued customers.

Table of Contents:
1. Introduction
2. Accessing the Internal Backend
3. Account Checking Process
   a. Verifying Account Details
   b. Checking Account Status and Restrictions
   c. Reviewing Transaction History
   d. Analyzing Account Logs
4. Contact Information for Technical Support
5. Additional Resources

1. Introduction:
This guide aims to assist Customer Support employees in effectively utilizing our internal backend systems to investigate customer account-related issues. Following the steps provided will enable you to access account details, review transaction history, and analyze account logs, empowering you to offer accurate and timely support to our customers.

2. Accessing the Internal Backend:
To access the internal backend system, follow these steps:
   - Launch the web browser and enter the internal backend URL: http://backend.intranet.zephyr-bank.com
   - Enter your unique username and password provided by the IT department to log in
   - Upon successful login, you will be redirected to the main dashboard of the internal backend system.

3. Account Checking Process:
a. Verifying Account Details:
   - Enter the customer's account number, username, or registered email address in the search bar within the internal backend dashboard.
   - Click on the "Search" button to retrieve the account information associated with the provided details.
   - Verify the customer's personal details, contact information, and linked accounts, ensuring accuracy.

b. Checking Account Status and Restrictions:
   - Access the "Account Status" section within the account details page to review the current account status.
   - Check for any outstanding restrictions, holds, or flagged transactions that may affect account functionality.
   - If restrictions are present, make note of the relevant details for further investigation or escalation.

c. Reviewing Transaction History:
   - Navigate to the "Transaction History" tab within the account details page.
   - Set the desired date range to retrieve the customer's transaction history for the specified period.
   - Analyze transactions, looking for any anomalies, fraudulent activities, or potential causes for reported issues.
   - Make a note of any specific transactions that may require further investigation or clarification.

d. Analyzing Account Logs:
   - Access the "Account Logs" section within the account details page.
   - Review system-generated logs related to the customer's account activities.
   - Pay attention to any logged errors, warnings, or notable events that may have impacted the account.
   - Record relevant log details to provide accurate information when communicating with the Technical Support team, if necessary.

5. Additional Resources:
For additional information and support, consult the following internal resources:
- Internal Backend User Manual: http://kb.internal.zephyr-bank.com/account-management/user-manual
- Troubleshooting FAQs: http://kb.internal.zephyr-bank.com/troubleshooting-faqs

Remember to handle customer data and information in a confidential and secure manner, adhering to company policies and privacy regulations.

Title: Customer Support App Troubleshooting Guide

Document Purpose:
This App Troubleshooting Guide is specifically designed for Customer Support employees to assist them in debugging and resolving issues reported by our app users. It provides detailed steps and resources to help identify and resolve common app-related problems. Please follow the guidelines outlined below to effectively assist our valued customers.

Table of Contents:
1. Introduction
2. System Requirements
3. Common Issues and Solutions
   a. App Installation and Launch Issues
   b. Account and Login Issues
   c. Performance and Responsiveness Issues
   d. Error Messages and Error Codes
4. Additional Resources
   a. Internal Knowledge Base
   b. User Manuals and Guides
5. Contact Information

1. Introduction:
As part of our commitment to delivering excellent customer service, this troubleshooting guide aims to equip Customer Support representatives with the necessary tools to troubleshoot app-related issues. By following the outlined steps, you will be able to efficiently assist customers in resolving their concerns and making their app experience smoother.

2. System Requirements:
Before troubleshooting, ensure that the user's device meets the minimum system requirements to run our app. These requirements include:
- Operating System: iOS 14 or Android 10 (or later)
- Device Compatibility: iPhone 6S (or equivalent) or newer, or Android devices with at least 2GB RAM

3. Common Issues and Solutions:
a. App Installation and Launch Issues:
   - Ensure that the app is downloaded from a trusted source such as the App Store or Google Play Store.
   - Instruct the user to check if their device has sufficient storage space for the app.
   - Direct them to uninstall and reinstall the app if installation issues persist.
   - If the app fails to launch, ask the user to force close the app, restart their device, and try launching it again.

b. Account and Login Issues:
   - Verify if the user is entering their correct login credentials (username and password) and check for any typos or incorrect input.
   - Advise the user to reset their password if they are unable to login or experiencing authentication issues.
   - Check the account status on our backend systems, ensuring there are no account-specific restrictions or errors.
   - If necessary, escalate the issue to the Technical Support team for further investigation.

c. Performance and Responsiveness Issues:
   - Instruct the user to close any unnecessary background apps to free up system resources.
   - Check for any known server issues or maintenance periods that may affect app performance.
   - If the app is running slower than usual, suggest clearing the app cache or reinstalling the app.
   - Ask the user to restart their device and test the app performance again.

d. Error Messages and Error Codes:
   - Ask the user to provide the exact error message and any associated error codes.
   - Consult our internal knowledge base for error code interpretation and suggested troubleshooting steps.
   - If the situation requires further investigation, forward the error details to the Technical Support team for a timely resolution.

4. Additional Resources:
To find additional assistance and more detailed information, refer to the following internal resources:

a. Internal Knowledge Base:
   - Access internal knowledge base articles that cover common app-related issues and their resolutions.

b. User Manuals and Guides:

Welcome to ZephyrBank! We are excited to have you join our Customer Support team. This guide will provide you with all the necessary information about our internal structure, key people, resources, and instructions to get your credentials for accessing the internal backend system.

1. Internal Structure:
ZephyrBank operates with a well-defined internal structure to ensure efficient operations and seamless customer service. Here are the key departments and teams you need to be aware of:

- Customer Support: You are now a part of our Customer Support department, responsible for addressing customer queries, resolving issues, and providing exceptional service.
- Technology: Our Technology department manages our systems, infrastructure, and software development to ensure a reliable and secure banking environment.
- Operations: The Operations department handles day-to-day banking activities, including deposit operations and loan operations, to ensure smooth transactions for our customers.
- Business Development: This department focuses on identifying and developing new business opportunities, such as partnerships and expansion plans.
